items.prompt: He couldn’t attend the meeting ______ he was feeling unwell. He couldn’t attend the meeting because he was feeling unwell.
______ the heavy rain, the match was postponed. Due to the heavy rain, the match was postponed.
She is very talented; ______ , she needs more experience. She is very talented; however, she needs more experience.
______ it was raining, we decided to stay indoors. Although it was raining, we decided to stay indoors.
This rule applies to everyone; ______ , no exceptions are allowed. This rule applies to everyone; therefore, no exceptions are allowed.
______ you study harder, you won’t pass the exam. Unless you study harder, you won’t pass the exam.
She completed the project on time ______ facing many challenges. She completed the project on time despite facing many challenges.
I love Italian food. ______ , pizza is one of my favorites. I love Italian food. For example, pizza is one of my favorites.
He was very tired; ______ , he managed to finish his work. He was very tired; nevertheless, he managed to finish his work.
______ we were waiting, he called to apologize for being late. While we were waiting, he called to apologize for being late.
She didn’t bring an umbrella ______ the weather forecast was clear. She didn’t bring an umbrella because the weather forecast was clear.
He didn’t get the job ______ his lack of experience. He didn’t get the job due to his lack of experience.
We were early for the concert; ______ , we had time for coffee. We were early for the concert; as a result, we had time for coffee.
______ you tell the truth, they won’t believe you. Unless you tell the truth, they won’t believe you.
I enjoy classical music. ______ , Beethoven is my favorite composer. I enjoy classical music. For example, Beethoven is my favorite composer.
He was nervous before the presentation. ______ , he did well. He was nervous before the presentation. Nevertheless, he did well.
______ the meeting started, she was preparing her notes. While the meeting started, she was preparing her notes.
He prefers quiet places. ______ , his brother loves loud music. He prefers quiet places. On the other hand, his brother loves loud music.
______ it was his birthday, he didn’t celebrate. Although it was his birthday, he didn’t celebrate.
______ , we can say that teamwork is essential for success. In conclusion, we can say that teamwork is essential for success.
She loves to travel. She doesn’t like flying. She loves to travel, however, she doesn’t like flying.
The event was canceled. It was raining heavily. The event was canceled due to the heavy rain.
He works hard. He is not happy with his job. He works hard, yet he is not happy with his job.
The shop offers a wide range of products. The prices are very high. The shop offers a wide range of products, but the prices are very high.
She was running late. She managed to catch the train. Although she was running late, she managed to catch the train.
I enjoy swimming. I don’t like crowded pools. I enjoy swimming; on the other hand, I don’t like crowded pools.
He failed the exam. He didn’t study enough. He failed the exam because he didn’t study enough.
We will go hiking. The weather must be good. We will go hiking if the weather is good.
The book is very informative. It’s written for beginners. The book is very informative, especially since it’s written for beginners.
She is very busy. She always makes time for her family. Despite being very busy, she always makes time for her family.
I wanted to help. I didn’t know what to do. I wanted to help, but I didn’t know what to do.
He was tired. He continued working. Although he was tired, he continued working.
We waited for the rain to stop. Then we left. We left when the rain stopped.
I’ll join you. I finish my homework first. I’ll join you when I finish my homework.
We won’t succeed. We work together. We won’t succeed unless we work together.
She didn’t set the alarm. She overslept. She overslept because she didn’t set the alarm.
I studied all night. I passed the test. I studied all night; as a result, I passed the test.
He stayed home. He wasn’t feeling well. He stayed home because he wasn’t feeling well.
They were talking. The teacher walked in. They were talking when the teacher walked in.
I’ll wait here. You come back. I’ll wait here until you come back.
